newsitem.title: FRANCE: French contingent to leave for Albania Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: French contingent to leave for Albania Tuesday.

text.p: The 1,000-strong French contingent in an international force for Albania will start leaving on Tuesday from the Mediterranean port of Toulon, the Defence Ministry said on Monday.

The ministry said two French Navy ships and two chartered ships will take the French marines, backed by combat engineers and equipped with wheeled tanks and armoured personnel carriers, to the Albanian port of Durres.

The French contingent will be part of a force of about 5,000 men approved by the United Nations to protect relief convoys in Albania which has been wracked by violence in a rebellion prompted by the collapse of popular pyramid savings schemes.
The ministry said military planning for the Italian-led force was going on in Italy and French army officers would be included in its command.
Italy is expected to provide 2,000 to 2,500 troops, France 1,000, Greece 700, Turkey 500, Spain 500 and Romania 400.

French military sources say the French contingent will pack a heavy punch in order to discourage armed bands from preying on aid convoys. Groups armed with weapons looted from army depots have been roaming the lawless country for weeks.
